headline.main: FBI Chief: No Charges for Clinton After New Emails Reviewed
headline.print_headline: FBI Chief: No Charges for Clinton After New Emails Reviewed

docs.snippet: FBI Director James Comey told Congress in a letter sent Sunday that a review of newly discovered Hillary Clinton emails has "not changed our conclusions" from earlier this year that she should not face charges....
docs.lead_paragraph: FBI Director James Comey told Congress in a letter sent Sunday that a review of newly discovered Hillary Clinton emails has "not changed our conclusions" from earlier this year that she should not face charges.

headline.main: Arkansas' Redlicki, Ohio State's Di Lorenzo Win Indoor Title
headline.print_headline: Arkansas' Redlicki, Ohio State's Di Lorenzo Win Indoor Title

docs.snippet: Arkansas senior Michael Redlicki and Ohio State sophomore Francesca Di Lorenzo swept the USTA/ITA National Indoor Intercollegiate Championships on Sunday at the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center....
docs.lead_paragraph: Arkansas senior Michael Redlicki and Ohio State sophomore Francesca Di Lorenzo swept the USTA/ITA National Indoor Intercollegiate Championships on Sunday at the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center.

headline.main: Black Pastors Issue Urgent Plea to Voters at Sunday Services
headline.print_headline: Black Pastors Issue Urgent Plea to Voters at Sunday Services

docs.snippet: At Sunday services, in rallies and on social media, black pastors urged congregants to vote, hoping to inspire a late flood of African-American turnout that could help propel Democrat Hillary Clinton to victory in critical swing states on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: At Sunday services, in rallies and on social media, black pastors urged congregants to vote, hoping to inspire a late flood of African-American turnout that could help propel Democrat Hillary Clinton to victory in critical swing states on Tuesday.

headline.main: Libyan Forces Report 14 Civilians Freed From Islamic State in Sirte
headline.print_headline: Libyan Forces Report 14 Civilians Freed From Islamic State in Sirte

docs.snippet: Libyan forces in the final stages of a six-month campaign to recapture Sirte from Islamic State said they freed 14 civilians on Sunday from a small residential area where some militants are holding out....
docs.lead_paragraph: Libyan forces in the final stages of a six-month campaign to recapture Sirte from Islamic State said they freed 14 civilians on Sunday from a small residential area where some militants are holding out.

headline.main: Letter From F.B.I. Related to Clinton Email Case

docs.snippet: James B. Comey, the F.B.I. director, said in a letter to members of Congress that “based on our review, we have not changed our conclusions that we expressed in July with respect to Secretary Clinton.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: James B. Comey, the F.B.I. director, said in a letter to members of Congress that “based on our review, we have not changed our conclusions that we expressed in July with respect to Secretary Clinton.”

headline.main: U.S. Citizen Held in Yemen for More Than 18 Months Freed
headline.print_headline: U.S. Citizen Held in Yemen for More Than 18 Months Freed

docs.snippet: A U.S. citizen who was detained for more than a year and a half by the Houthi faction in Yemen has been released, Secretary of State John Kerry said on Sunday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. citizen who was detained for more than a year and a half by the Houthi faction in Yemen has been released, Secretary of State John Kerry said on Sunday.

headline.main: Beware, iPhone Users: Fake Retail Apps Are Surging Before Holidays
headline.print_headline: A Surge of Deceptive Apps for iPhones  Arrives in Time for Holiday Shopping

docs.snippet: Hundreds of rogue apps, most of which came from developers in China, have managed to slip through Apple’s review process....
docs.abstract: Barrage of fake retail and product apps are popping up in Apple App Store, apparently designed to deceive holiday shoppers; phony apps, which mostly come from developers in China, appear to have slipped through Apple's process for reviewing every app before publishing it.

byline.contributor: Emily Feng contributed reporting from Beijing.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of rogue apps, most of which came from developers in China, have managed to slip through Apple’s review process.

headline.main: As Health System Collapses, Zimbabwe Turns to Street Herbs
headline.print_headline: As Health System Collapses, Zimbabwe Turns to Street Herbs

docs.snippet: Zimbabwe's public health system is collapsing along with the economy, with some major hospitals suspending all non-emergency surgeries because painkillers are scarce....
docs.lead_paragraph: Zimbabwe's public health system is collapsing along with the economy, with some major hospitals suspending all non-emergency surgeries because painkillers are scarce.
